description: <p><strong><span><span>Are you a Registered Nurse with a passion for delivering end of life care in the community? If the answer is yes, then we have an exciting opportunity. Working across our Reactive Emergency Assessment Community Team (REACT) and St Elizabeth Hospice the successful candidate support patients who are approaching the end of their life to die at home. </span></span></strong></p><p><strong><span><span>Based with REACT the successful candidate will work between the hours of 6pm and 11pm.</span></span></strong></p><p><strong><span><span>REACT are a multi-agency service delivering excellent patient focused care to patients in the East Suffolk community. You will work as a valued, key member of our multi-disciplinary team with excellent induction and training support. The successful candidate will have experience of working in a community setting and palliative care. The role will involve delivering end of life care in the patient’s home as part of community nursing out of hours. In addition the successful candidate will work within a team of therapists, generic workers and with social care and the voluntary sector to provide holistic assessments in a patient’s home and primary care settings. The successful applicant should be motivated, flexible and committed to working in an ever changing environment.</span></span></strong></p><p><strong><span><span>The role involves travelling throughout East Suffolk. The post holder will be expected to cover evenings, weekend/bank holiday shifts and is a 1 year fixed term post.</span></span></strong></p><p><strong><span><span>In return we are committed to support you in your professional development and chosen career pathway, ensuring you have opportunities to demonstrate your skills, abilities and appropriate training and support to reach your potential.</span></span></strong></p><p>For further details / informal visits contact:</p><p><strong>Karen Large - General Manager - Community Nursing and Therapy - <span>07843505131</span></strong></p>
